#  import the necessary libraries and load the files needed for Exploratory Data Analysis

# import pandas library for data analysis and manipulation
import pandas as pd                        

# import numpy library to perform mathematical operations
import numpy as np           

# import seaborn library for data visualisation and exploratory data analysis
import seaborn as sns 

# plotting graphs
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

# renders plot inline on your page
%matplotlib inline   

# to add colors
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches

source.9b04ccfe:
avocado_types=['4046', '4225', '4770']

pos = np.arange(len(avocado_types))

sum_4046=round(avocado_data_2017['4046'].sum())
sum_4225=round(avocado_data_2017['4225'].sum())
sum_4770=round(avocado_data_2017['4770'].sum())

avocado_sold=[sum_4046,sum_4225,sum_4770]

plt.bar(pos,avocado_sold,color='blue',edgecolor='black')
plt.xticks(pos, avocado_types)
plt.xlabel('Avocado Variety', fontsize=16)
plt.ylabel('Total avocado sold per Variety', fontsize=16)
plt.title('Avocado Sales per Variety',fontsize=20)
plt.show()
source.9d8f5ffc:
avocado_types=['4046', '4225', '4770']
type=['conventional','organic']
pos = np.arange(len(avocado_types))
bar_width = 0.35

sum_4046_conventional=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='conventional','4046'].sum())
sum_4046_organic=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='organic','4046'].sum())

sum_4225_conventional=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='conventional','4225'].sum())
sum_4225_organic=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='organic','4225'].sum())

sum_4770_conventional=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='conventional','4770'].sum())
sum_4770_organic=round(avocado_data_2017.loc[avocado_data_2017['Type']=='organic','4770'].sum())

sum_convential=[sum_4046_conventional,sum_4225_conventional,sum_4770_conventional]
sum_organic=[sum_4046_organic,sum_4225_organic,sum_4770_organic]

plt.bar(pos,sum_convential,bar_width,color='blue',edgecolor='black')
plt.bar(pos+bar_width,sum_organic,bar_width,color='pink',edgecolor='black')
plt.xticks(pos, avocado_types)
plt.xlabel('Avocado Variety Per Type', fontsize=16)
plt.ylabel('Total avocado sold per Variety', fontsize=16)
plt.title('Avocado Sales per Variety',fontsize=18)
plt.legend(type,loc=2)
plt.show()
source.49857ff4:
import warnings

import pandas as pd
from pandas.core.common import SettingWithCopyWarning

warnings.simplefilter(action="ignore", category=SettingWithCopyWarning)

avocado_data_2017['Month'] = pd.DatetimeIndex(avocado_data_2017['Date']).month
pd.options.mode.chained_assignment = None
#avocado_data_2017['Month'] = pd.DatetimeIndex(avocado_data_2017['Date']).month
avocado_data_2017['Month'] = pd.to_datetime(avocado_data_2017['Month'], format='%m').dt.month_name()
source.f0188000:
a = pd.DataFrame(avocado_data_2017[avocado_data_2017['Type'].str.contains("organic")].groupby('Month').mean().AveragePrice)
b = pd.DataFrame(avocado_data_2017[avocado_data_2017['Type'].str.contains("conventional")].groupby('Month').mean().AveragePrice)
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 10))
sns.pointplot(x=a.index, y = 'AveragePrice', data=a,color='blue')
sns.pointplot(x=a.index, y = 'AveragePrice', data=b,color='green')

#plt.legend(labels=['organic', 'conventional'])

pop_a = mpatches.Patch(color='blue', label='organic')
pop_b = mpatches.Patch(color='green', label='conventional')

plt.legend(handles=[pop_a,pop_b])

plt.show()
source.6b779a96: Conventional avocadoes are more preferable than organic probably because of lower price than organic
source.2447d678: Tampa is the region with highest average price and CincinnatiDayton is the region with lowest average price.
source.71bb0244: ## 5) How is the distribution of average price across the year of 2017?
source.220a6de8:
# Introduction This project is done as part of Google Data analytics capstone project. A data set is selected from Kaggle and analysed for the questions to be answered. # Dataset Avocado Prices (made available by Justin Kiggins under a CC0 license): Historical data about avocado prices and sales in grocery stores throughout the United States. Link: https://www.kaggle.com/neuromusic/avocado-prices Some relevant columns in the dataset: Date - The date of the observation AveragePrice - the average price of a single avocado type - conventional or organic year - the year Region - the city or region of the observation Total Volume - Total number of avocados sold 4046 - Total number of avocados with PLU 4046 sold 4225 - Total number of avocados with PLU 4225 sold 4770 - Total number of avocados with PLU 4770 sold The Average Price (of avocados) in the table reflects a per unit (per avocado) cost, even when multiple units (avocados) are sold in bags. The Product Lookup codes (PLU’s) in the table are only for Hass avocados. Other varieties of avocados (e.g. greenskins) are not included in this table. This data was downloaded from the Hass Avocado Board website in May of 2018. # Questions to be answered 1) In which regions are avocados with top 10 and least 10 average prices in year 2017 ?Which avocado type was most sold in 2017?
2) Which avocado type was most sold in 2017?
3) In which month was the most avocado bags sold in 2017?
4) Which type of avocadoes are more popular - conventional or organic?
5) How is the distribution of average price across the year of 2017?
source.e311a5b7: ##  3) In which month was the most avocado bags sold in 2017?
source.7f66ef61: ## 4) Which type of avocadoes are more popular - conventional or organic?
source.bc4a9768: Highest average price was recorded in September and lowest in January
source.182bbac7: ##  2) Which avocado type was most sold in 2017?

## 1) In which regions are avocados with top 10 and least 10 average prices in year 2017 ?
